meanings.definition: To make persistent demands on someone, especially for payment of a debt.
meanings.sent1: The landlord would dun the tenant for the overdue rent every day.
meanings.sent2: She duns her brother to return the money he borrowed.
meanings.sent3: The cat would dun the owner for treats by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The persistent rain seemed to dun the earth for moisture.
meanings.sent5: The teacher would dun the students for their homework assignments.

meanings.sent1: The old sofa had a comfortable dun hue.
meanings.sent2: The artist mixed black and brown to create a beautiful dun shade.
meanings.sent3: The dun paint on the walls made the room feel cozy.
meanings.sent4: The dun of the rocks blended perfectly with the sandy beach.
meanings.sent5: The dun of the dog's fur matched the color of the muddy path.

meanings.definition: A horse of a dull brownish color.
meanings.sent1: The farmer rode his dun horse across the fields.
meanings.sent2: The dun mare grazed peacefully in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The dun pony nuzzled up to the children for carrots.
meanings.sent4: The dun stallion galloped gracefully in the pasture.
meanings.sent5: The dun colt playfully kicked up its heels in the paddock.
